meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of quinone.
meanings.sent1: The quinoidal compound showed a deep red color under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Her research focused on the quinoidal properties of certain chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The quinoidal reaction in the lab caused quite a colorful explosion!
meanings.sent4: The sky turned quinoidal as the sun set, painting the clouds in vibrant hues.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a quinoidal palette to create a striking contrast in the painting.

meanings.definition: Having a structure similar to quinone.
meanings.sent1: The new material had a quinoidal shape that made it stand out.
meanings.sent2: The quinoidal pattern on the fabric caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The quinoidal design of the building made it look futuristic and unique.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a quinoidal flow, resembling the curves of a quinone molecule.
meanings.sent5: The quinoidal structure of the crystal refracted light in a mesmerizing way.

meanings.sent1: The quinoidal taste of the medicine lingered on her tongue.
meanings.sent2: The quinoidal aroma of the tonic water filled the room.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the quinoidal drink was his secret to staying awake.
meanings.sent4: The quinoidal flavor of the cocktail transported her to a tropical paradise.
meanings.sent5: The quinoidal ingredient added a unique kick to the dish.
